book.author: George Orwell
book.funfact: '1984' introduced concepts like Big Brother, Newspeak, and the thought police, which have become part of the cultural lexicon.

book2.name: To Kill a Mockingbird
book2.author: Harper Lee
book2.funfact: Harper Lee's only published novel, it won the Pulitzer Prize for Fiction in 1961 and has become a classic of American literature.

book3.name: Pride and Prejudice
book3.author: Jane Austen
book3.funfact: Jane Austen initially published the book anonymously, and it has since become one of the most beloved novels in English literature.

book4.name: The Great Gatsby
book4.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
book4.funfact: Although it received mixed reviews upon its release, 'The Great Gatsby' is now considered a masterpiece and a classic portrayal of the Jazz Age.

book5.name: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
book5.author: J.K. Rowling
book5.funfact: The first book in the immensely popular Harry Potter series, it launched a global phenomenon and has sold millions of copies worldwide.

book6.name: The Lord of the Rings
book6.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
book6.funfact: Originally intended as a single novel, 'The Lord of the Rings' was split into three volumes due to post-war paper shortages.

book7.name: Moby-Dick
book7.author: Herman Melville
book7.funfact: Despite its initial commercial failure, 'Moby-Dick' is now considered one of the greatest works of American literature.

book8.name: The Catcher in the Rye
book8.author: J.D. Salinger
book8.funfact: Controversial and influential, 'The Catcher in the Rye' is often studied in schools and has been widely banned and challenged.

book9.name: The Hobbit
book9.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
book9.funfact: 'The Hobbit' was initially written as a standalone children's story but later became the prelude to Tolkien's larger Middle-earth saga.

book10.name: The Alchemist
book10.author: Paulo Coelho
book10.funfact: Originally published in Portuguese, 'The Alchemist' has been translated into numerous languages and has sold over 150 million copies worldwide.
